title: Frustrating Experience with Account Ban and Poor Support
text:
I recently faced an extremely disappointing experience with WhatsApp while traveling overseas. After updating my phone number in the app, my account was inexplicably banned within minutes. Efforts to appeal the ban were unsuccessful, as I was met with a permanent ban, just days before Christmas, leaving me stranded without any means to contact my friends and family through the app.

The support process was equally disheartening. Over several days, the support team provided no clear resolution, repeatedly asking the same questions and offering generic, non-sensical responses. They insisted on verifying my account through the app, which was impossible due to the ban. Moreover, their claim of me violating their terms of service was vague, with no specific details provided. Eventually, they inaccurately accused me of using a third-party app, which was not the case since I only had the official WhatsApp app.

This ordeal cost me over 6 years of accumulated activity, valuable contacts, and control over a group where I was the admin. The lack of effective support and the arbitrary nature of the ban have significantly diminished my trust in WhatsApp. If it weren't for others using the platform, I would have abandoned it altogether. This has been one of the worst experiences I've had with a service in a long time, and I urge potential users to consider this when deciding to use WhatsApp.

title: Group management a painful flaw
text: Whatsapp is a wonderful app that I have used on a daily basis for years. but it has one abysmal defect.  For years it has been difficult, if not impossible to easily list the groups that you are a member of. As a result, duplicate groups get made because people forget that a similar group had already been created in the past, and there is no easy way to quickly list and edit the groups you are member off. There are hacks you can find on the internet to get around this problem, but for heavy users like me who belong to dozens of groups, this is a source of endless frustration. This last version finally offers a partial workaround, that is that in the new communities section you can pretend to create a new community and see in the process a list of the groups to which you have admin privileges. But this is just another work around, and it does not show you the groups that you are only a member of. For such a mature program to lack such a basic feature passes understanding. If this was 1.0 version of the software I‚Äôd give it 4 stars. But for a program that‚Äôs been on the market for years, this omission is inexcusable, especially considering that competing platforms allow you to manage groups with ease.

title: **UNSAFE DO NOT USE**
text:
My account and multiple people I work with all had our accounts hacked on the same day. WhatsApp claims that when you verify your phone number, any accounts still logged in on other devices will automatically log off, and they will have to verify your phone number. This is not true, for the people that hacked our workplace was still able to use our numbers and impersonate us. We have screenshots and a record of the times on Reddit. Not only did they take over our phone numbers, but they also changed the six-digit security pin and the emails associated with our accounts. 

Customer support does not exist. There is nobody to talk to. You can send an email, but you‚Äôll get an automated reply. They said that you could wait seven days to log into your account without a six-digit pin and delete your account that way. So while you wait the seven days, they have full access to your account and number. 

WhatsApp is only end-to-end encrypted, meaning all messages are stored on the device that initially sent the message. Everything else can easily be exploited to gain access to your account. This severe security flaw has been used repeatedly with the addition of zero customer support.

title: Appalling Experience! Arbitrary Number Suspension by WhatsApp!
text:
During my recent travel to a foreign country, WhatsApp shockingly suspended my phone number without any valid explanation. As we're aware, in many parts of Europe and Latin America, businesses rely heavily on WhatsApp for customer communication. In fact, I was explicitly advised by the hotels in Peru to use WhatsApp as the primary means of contact during my stay.

Right in the midst of providing crucial information to the hotel for my pickup arrangement, WhatsApp abruptly disabled my number. I promptly submitted a review request to reinstate my number, but to my utter dismay, WhatsApp not only failed to address the issue but completely banned my number!

I found myself stranded in the remote mountains of Peru, desperately needing to contact the hotel for pickup. Unfortunately, the hotel didn't answer my phone calls, and I couldn't communicate in the local language. To make matters worse, this happened just as the sun was setting. The timing of WhatsApp's arbitrary number suspension couldn't have been more disastrous, leaving me in a state of extreme distress with no means of reaching the hotel.

title: Definitely set 2FA !!
text:
Love WhatsApp. Use it more than any other app.  100x better than SMS!  However, it recently was hacked. And the person that did it, tried to scam my friends, family and business associates out of money by saying he was me and needed to borrow money. C‚Äômon whatsapp! Figure out how to shut these guys down. Use the power of Facebook and figure it out!
